alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Talbot; Taylor; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:41PM EST until January 12 at 10:41PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Taylor, Crawford, Upson and Talbot Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Carsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville. * WHEN...From this evening to late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding begins along the river in the woodlands and low lying areas of fields upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 19. The water level will reach the top of a boat ramp by the bridge on the Taylor County side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM EST Tuesday was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.7 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.6 feet on 02/24/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 845 AM EST.
